summary: In this context, ethylbenzene is identified as a volatile organic compound (VOC) that is commonly emitted into the environment due to its presence in petroleum products. The discussion highlights the environmental hazards posed by VOCs, including ethylbenzene, which are prioritized for regulation under the European Water Framework Directive due to their toxic properties. This establishes a direct link between ethylbenzene and petroleum, as the latter is a significant source of the former.
